headline.main: NEWS BY TELEGRAPH.; Interesting Debate in the Senate on the Pacific Railroad Bill. Military Possession of Sonora and Chihuahua - Presents to Consuls - Commodore Stewart to be Restored - The English and Montgomery Affair - A Mysterious Association, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Secretary of War has not furnished to the Military Committee his reply to the call for estimates for holding military possession of Sonora and Chihuahua. The Committee on Foreign Relations of the House will report a resolution authorizing Consuls to receive presents from foreign Governments.

headline.main: THE BENNETT DIVORCE CASE.; SIXTEENTH DAY. CONCLUDING TESTIMONY FOR THE RESPONDENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: NEW-HAVEN, Monday Morning. The witness, for whom the respondent in this case has been waiting, appeared this morning. She is Mrs. Ezra Sanford. Sickness has prevented her coming into court before. Her testimony is as follows: Became acquainted with Mrs. Bennett in '55; became intimately acquainted with her in '56; Mrs. B.

headline.main: IMPORTANT FROM MEXICO.; Intervention of the French Government in Mexican Affairs. Interesting Narrative of Captivity in a Mexican Prison. Process of Political Disorganization.

docs.lead_paragraph: The proposed execution of the persons implicated in the assassination plot of the 16th September last, is the first event noticeable since tile date of my last letter to you. The criminals (7) were thrown in capilla on the day previous to the departure of the last mail, but the circumstance was not openly proclaimed until too late to notify you of the fact.

docs.snippet: The steamship Arabia, of the Cunara one, arrived at Boston on Saturday afternoon, and her mails were forwarded the same evening. To the summary of news to the 4th inst., received by telegraph from Halifax, we add other particulars of interest. The...

headline.main: EUROPE.; Arrival of the Mails by the Arabia.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steamship Arabia, of the Cunara one, arrived at Boston on Saturday afternoon, and her mails were forwarded the same evening. To the summary of news to the 4th inst., received by telegraph from Halifax, we add other particulars of interest. The steamship Indian Empire arrived at Broadhaven at 9 A. M. on Friday, the 26th November.

headline.main: THE BENNETT DIVORCE CASE.; MORE EVIDENCE AGAINST THE APPLICANT Testimony as to the Lady's Domestic Habits and Disposition--How She Drubbed the Doctor.

docs.lead_paragraph: THIRTEENTH DAY--[CONCLUDED.] FROM OUR OWN REPORTER. The divorce case was beginning to grow stupid, but revived this afternoon. It is now in about the same condition as was the venerable city of New-Haven for the first three days of the week, to wit, completely befogged.

docs.snippet: The evidence for the prosecution in the ALLIBONE and NEWHALL case closed Dec. 16, and the defence was opened. Mr. BREWSTER made the opening speech, giving a history of the case, and adding an explanation o Mr. ALLIBONE'S departure from the country,...
docs.lead_paragraph: The evidence for the prosecution in the ALLIBONE and NEWHALL case closed Dec. 16, and the defence was opened. Mr. BREWSTER made the opening speech, giving a history of the case, and adding an explanation o Mr. ALLIBONE'S departure from the country, as follows: "For many years Mr. ALLINBONE has been labering under a disease which approached its crisis in the Fall of 1857.

headline.main: THE CENTRAL AMERICAN IMBROGLIO.; Explanatory Correspondence Concerning the British Visit to the Washington. IMPORTANT OFFICIAL DOCUMENTS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The subjoined letters of Secretary Cass and Mr. DALLAS, owing to telegraphic delay, were published in only a part of yesterday's impression. Of the remaining documents, which consist chiefly of letters that passed between Commodore McINTOSH and Sir W. C. ALDHAM, Captain of H. B. M. steam-frigate Valorous, in relation to the visit of British officers to the Washington, only a summery has appeared.

docs.snippet: WHAT SHALL BE DONE WITH THE PARK.--The lovers of rural simplicity must have been gratified with tile appearance of the Park yesterday. It was converted. into a sheep pasture, and presented a striking picture of rustic life,--the ragged girls who...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHAT SHALL BE DONE WITH THE PARK.--The lovers of rural simplicity must have been gratified with tile appearance of the Park yesterday. It was converted. into a sheep pasture, and presented a striking picture of rustic life,--the ragged girls who sweep the crossings answering in place of woodland nymphs, and a few stalwart Irishmen with brooms filling the parts of shepherds will their crooks.

docs.snippet: AMERICAN INSTITUTE--MECHANICS' CLUB.--At the regular meeting of the Club, held on Thursday evening, the subject of warning and ventilating buildings was again disscussed. The opinions of experienced men seemed to point to the conclusion that the same...
docs.lead_paragraph: AMERICAN INSTITUTE--MECHANICS' CLUB.--At the regular meeting of the Club, held on Thursday evening, the subject of warning and ventilating buildings was again disscussed. The opinions of experienced men seemed to point to the conclusion that the same method is not applicable in all cases.
